alert.note: Alert for Alamosa Vicinity, Central San Luis Valley Below 8500 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains Between 8500 And 11000 Ft; Northern Sangre de Cristo Mountains above 11000 Ft; Southern San Luis Valley; Southern Sangre De Cristo Mountains Between 7500 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 5:49PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Alamosa, west central Huerfano and northeastern Costilla Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 546 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles north of Blanca, or 16 miles west of Spring Burn Scar south of Highway 160 in Costilla county. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Torrential rainfall may cause quick rises of creeks and streams and ponding of water on roads and in low lying spots. Locations impacted include... Fort Garland and Blanca Peak and the Wagon and East Bear Creeks on the southwest edge of the Spring Burn Scar. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
